a.span: Help FSI buy our New Furniture!

div.p: We are Crew. We are Family. We are Bolts! #BOLTSTOGETHER

“Tell me and I forget.
Teach me and I remember.
Involve me and I learn.”
Learn more about our educational model.
Visit our free, public charter school.

div.h1: Innovation Isn’t a Passive Process. Neither is learning.
div.p: The Franklin School of Innovation is molding the next generation of leaders, explorers, inventors, and global citizens. We dare our students to achieve, to dig, to discover. We challenge them with big questions and problems. When students lead their own learning, they learn to lead us.

h3.a: Transitioning to Digital Learning: Expectations for Students, Parents, and Teachers

div.p: On Monday, March 23, we will begin full implementation of our digital learning plan. This week provided useful time for planning and for partial implementation, giving students and our faculty…

p.a: Read More about Transitioning to Digital Learning: Expectations for Students, Parents, and Teachers

h3.a: Mud Run is April 26, 2020! Register now!

div.p: Enjoy getting your feet wet….and MUDDY? Come join us for our annual Mud Run on April 26, 2020! Register NOW

div.article: Mar 17 – It’s Go Day – Help Your Student Log In & Go Virtual
Mar 13 – Coronavirus Update: Our response and preparations for possible virtual learning
Oct 30 – New! Girls Who Code Club coming to FSI!
Sep 13 – New Partnership with Blue Ridge Health!

div.p: To teach a student, you must know that student both academically and personally. Our faculty builds time into every school day to foster meaningful relationships with our children. FSI is not just a school, it’s a community.

An education shouldn’t occur solely within classroom walls. Community engagement is at the core of FSI. Our students learn through active service, such as helping clean up Hominy Creek, planting trees in our native tree nursery, and partnering on a home build with Habitat for Humanity.

blockquote.p: “Our daughter is now excited to tell us about her day. She said “everyone is friends” and loves that the teachers encourage the students to work together and to truly listen to one another. For her first few days, she said she had a headache when I picked her up. When I attributed this to the increased stress of starting a new school, she confidently said, “No, I really don’t feel stressed at all. I think my brain is just tired from working so hard!” It is such a thrill to see our child so excited about learning and using her brain to its fullest potential.”

div.p: The Franklin School of Innovation's mission is preparing the next generation of leaders, capable of solving problems and participating effectively and ethically as local and global citizens. Through challenging academics, real-world learning, and community engagement, our students discover their potential, develop persistence, and recognize the value of others. Our graduates are ready for the future they will create.
Sign up to receive periodic updates about our growing school.
